translation.text: Maaroo, Third Mehl:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

translation.text: Serve the True Creator Lord.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

translation.text: The Word of the Shabad is the Destroyer of pain.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

author.author: Guru Amar Das
author.description:
Guru Amar Das [1479 - 1574] was the third Guru of the Sikhs, born at Basarke in Amritsar. His father, Tej Bhan and mother Bakht Kaur were orthodox Hindus. He became the oldest Sikh Guru.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

text: ਅਗਮੁ ਅਗੋਚਰੁ ਕੀਮਤਿ ਨਹੀ ਪਾਈ ਆਪੇ ਅਗਮ ਅਥਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੧॥

translation.text: He is inaccessible and unfathomable; He cannot be evaluated. He Himself is inaccessible and immeasurable. ||1||

transliteration.text: agam agōchar kīmat nahī pāī āpē agam athāhā hē .1.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

translation.text: The True Lord Himself makes Truth pervasive.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

Guru Amar Das put an end to tradition of sati, the burning of the widow on her husbands funeral pyre, and encouraged the remarriage of widows. He opened 22 preaching centres called Manjees and founded the town of Goindwal as the headquarters for the Sikh community.

translation.text: He attaches some humble beings to the Truth.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਸਾਚੋ ਸੇਵਹਿ ਸਾਚੁ ਕਮਾਵਹਿ ਨਾਮੇ ਸਚਿ ਸਮਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੨॥

translation.text: They serve the True Lord and practice Truth; through the Name, they are absorbed in the True Lord. ||2||

transliteration.text: sāchō sēvah sāch kamāvah nāmē sach samāhā hē .2.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

translation.text: The Primal Lord unites His devotees in His Union.

translation.text: He attaches them to true devotional worship.

This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਸਾਚੀ ਬਾਣੀ ਸਦਾ ਗੁਣ ਗਾਵੈ ਇਸੁ ਜਨਮੈ ਕਾ ਲਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੩॥

translation.text: One who sings forever the Glorious Praises of the Lord, through the True Word of His Bani, earns the profit of this life. ||3||

transliteration.text: sāchī bānī sadā gun gāvai is janamai kā lāhā hē .3.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. Maru’s nature conveys the fearlessness and strength that ensures the truth is spoken, no matter what the cost.

text: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਵਣਜੁ ਕਰਹਿ ਪਰੁ ਆਪੁ ਪਛਾਣਹਿ ॥

translation.text: The Gurmukh trades, and understands his own self.

transliteration.text: guramukh vanaj karah par āp pashānah .

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. This Raag has an aggressive nature, which creates an inner strength and power to express and emphasise the truth, regardless of the consequences. text: ਏਕਸ ਬਿਨੁ ਕੋ ਅਵਰੁ ਨ ਜਾਣਹਿ ॥

translation.text: He knows no other than the One Lord.

transliteration.text: ēkas bin kō avar n jānah .

text: ਸਚਾ ਸਾਹੁ ਸਚੇ ਵਣਜਾਰੇ ਪੂੰਜੀ ਨਾਮੁ ਵਿਸਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੪॥

translation.text: True is the banker, and True are His traders, who buy the merchandise of the Naam. ||4||

transliteration.text: sachā sāh sachē vanajārē pūnjī nām visāhā hē .4.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੁ ਸੇਵਹਿ ਸੇ ਜਨ ਸਾਚੇ ਕਾਟੇ ਜਮ ਕਾ ਫਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੫॥

translation.text: Those humble beings who serve the True Guru are true. He snaps the noose of death from around their necks. ||5||

transliteration.text: satigur sēvah sē jan sāchē kātē jam kā phāhā hē .5.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਮਨਮੁਖ ਫਿਰਹਿ ਸਦਾ ਅੰਧੁ ਕਮਾਵਹਿ ਜਮ ਕਾ ਜੇਵੜਾ ਗਲਿ ਫਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੬॥

translation.text: The self-willed manmukhs wander around forever, acting blindly. Death has strung his noose around their necks. ||6||

transliteration.text: manamukh phirah sadā andh kamāvah jam kā jēvarā gal phāhā hē .6.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. translation.text: He Himself forgives, and enjoins us to serve the Guru.

translation.text: Through the Guru's Teachings, the Naam comes to dwell within the mind.

text: ਅਨਦਿਨੁ ਨਾਮੁ ਧਿਆਏ ਸਾਚਾ ਇਸੁ ਜਗ ਮਹਿ ਨਾਮੋ ਲਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੭॥

translation.text: Night and day, meditate on the Naam, the Name of the True Lord, and earn the profit of the Naam in this world. ||7||

transliteration.text: anadin nām dhiāē sāchā is jag mah nāmō lāhā hē .7.

text: ਜਿਨ ਮਨਿ ਵਸਿਆ ਸੇ ਜਨ ਸੋਹਹਿ ਤਿਨ ਸਿਰਿ ਚੂਕਾ ਕਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੮॥

translation.text: Noble and exalted are those, within whose mind the Lord abides. Their heads are free of strife. ||8||

transliteration.text: jin man vasiā sē jan sōhah tin sir chūkā kāhā hē .8.

melody.description: Maru was traditionally sung on the battlefield in preparation for war. text: ਸਦਾ ਸਬਦਿ ਸਾਲਾਹੀ ਗੁਣਦਾਤਾ ਲੇਖਾ ਕੋਇ ਨ ਮੰਗੈ ਤਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੯॥

translation.text: No one calls that person to account, who praises the Word of the Shabad, the Giver of virtue. ||9||

transliteration.text: sadā sabad sālāhī gunadātā lēkhā kōi n mangai tāhā hē .9.

text: ਬ੍ਰਹਮਾ ਬਿਸਨੁ ਰੁਦ੍ਰੁ ਤਿਸ ਕੀ ਸੇਵਾ ॥

translation.text: Brahma, Vishnu and Shiva serve Him.

transliteration.text: brahamā bisan rudr tis kī sēvā .

text: ਜਿਨ ਕਉ ਨਦਰਿ ਕਰਹਿ ਤੂ ਅਪਣੀ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੦॥

translation.text: Those who are blessed by Your Glance of Grace, become Gurmukh, and comprehend the incomprehensible. ||10||

transliteration.text: jin kau nadar karah tū apanī guramukh alakh lakhāhā hē .10.

text: ਨਾਮੁ ਜਪੀ ਤੈ ਨਾਮੁ ਧਿਆਈ ਮਹਲੁ ਪਾਇ ਗੁਣ ਗਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੧॥

translation.text: I chant the Naam, and meditate on the Naam. Singing His Glorious Praises, I enter the Mansion of the Lord's Presence. ||11||

transliteration.text: nām japī tai nām dhiāī mahal pāi gun gāhā hē .11.

translation.text: The self-willed manmukhs do not know the value of the Lord's Command.

text: ਹੁਕਮੇ ਮੰਨੇ ਹੁਕਮੇ ਵਡਿਆਈ ਹੁਕਮੇ ਵੇਪਰਵਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੨॥

translation.text: By the Hukam of the Lord's Command, one is exalted; by His Hukam, one is glorified; by His Hukam, one becomes carefree. ||12||

transliteration.text: hukamē mannē hukamē vadiāī hukamē vēparavāhā hē .12.

translation.text: The wandering mind is restrained, and brought back to the home of the One Lord.

text: ਨਾਮੇ ਰਾਤਾ ਸਦਾ ਬੈਰਾਗੀ ਨਾਮੁ ਰਤਨੁ ਮਨਿ ਤਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੩॥

translation.text: Imbued with the Naam, one remains forever detached; the jewel of the Naam rests within the mind. ||13||

transliteration.text: nāmē rātā sadā bairāgī nām ratan man tāhā hē .13.

text: ਸਭ ਜਗ ਮਹਿ ਵਰਤੈ ਏਕੋ ਸੋਈ ॥

translation.text: The One Lord is pervasive throughout all the world.

transliteration.text: sabh jag mah varatai ēkō sōī .

text: ਸਬਦੁ ਸਲਾਹਹਿ ਸੇ ਜਨ ਨਿਰਮਲ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਵਾਸਾ ਤਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੪॥

translation.text: Those humble beings who praise the Shabad are immaculate; they dwell within the home of their own inner self. ||14||

transliteration.text: sabad salāhah sē jan niramal nij ghar vāsā tāhā hē .14.

text: ਜਿਉ ਤੁਧੁ ਭਾਵਹਿ ਤਿਉ ਤੂ ਰਾਖਹਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਨਾਮੁ ਧਿਆਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੫॥

translation.text: As it pleases Your Will, You keep us; the Gurmukh meditates on the Naam. ||15||

text: ਨਾਨਕੁ ਸਾਚੁ ਕਹੈ ਬੇਨੰਤੀ ਸਚੁ ਦੇਵਹੁ ਸਚਿ ਸਮਾਹਾ ਹੇ ॥੧੬॥੧॥੧੦॥

translation.text: Nanak offers this true prayer: O Lord, please bless me with Truth, that I may merge in the Truth. ||16||1||10||

transliteration.text: nānak sāch kahai bēnantī sach dēvah sach samāhā hē .16.1.10.
